title: Title, Message and Buttons
content:
Title, Message and Buttons #  As a powerful ⚡️ UI component that can display a variety of different styles, we definitely don’t want to just use the default configuration, so here we start with three basic configurations: title, message and buttons.
Title #  Let’s start with the title.
textbox({ title: 'Hello', });  TRY  Did you see it? The title ‘Hello’ appears in the title bar, let’s turn it to red:
textbox({ title: { content: 'Hello', color: 'red', }, });  TRY  Message #  Like title, message has the same properties, so let’s put together ‘Hello World’.
textbox({ title: 'Hello', message: 'World', });  TRY  Buttons #  Let’s have some interactivity with the textbox. Change the default ‘OK’ button, we want to click it and then pop up a new textbox.
textbox({ title: 'Hello', message: 'World', button: { text: 'New TextBox', callback() { textbox(); }, }, });  TRY  Here you can have a second button to finish the cancel task.
textbox({ title: 'Hello', message: 'World', button: [{ text: 'New TextBox', callback() { textbox(); }, }, 'Cancel'], });  TRY  Let’s have an advanced interaction. Can we make the current textbox disappear and then pop up a textbox with the same configuration after clicking this button?
 If we want to make the textbox disappear after clicking the button, try return true in the callback.
 function generate() { textbox({ title: 'Hello', message: 'World', button: { text: 'Generate', callback() { generate(); return true; }, }, }); }; generate();  TRY

title: Getting Started
content:
Getting Started #  Welcome again, this page will introduce the simplest usage of textbox and hopefully it will bring you the desire to continue exploring or to contribute to this project.
For now, textbox is still in beta, but you can still copy the textbox.js code here.  The simplest usage #  textbox();  TRY  If everything works, you will see the following result after pressing TRY. If not, please contact us.
Your HTML code may look like:
<!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> <title>...</title> ... </head> <body> ... </body> <script src="textbox.js"></script> </html> What’s next #
